page.title: 04SCAWSBY PAST 2
page.content: {Scawsby}appears in the Domesday Book. The entry says:-"In{Scalchebi} {(Scawsby)}Alsi had five carucates of land to be taxed, where there may be three ploughs. This land belongs to Brodeuuorde(Brodsworth) two carucates inland and three carucates soke. Roger has now there three ploughs, and eight villanes and five bordars, with three ploughs. Coppice wood four quarentens long and four broad." In 1379 the monks of Bretton Priory recorded that seven married couples and thirteen single people were living in{Scawsby.}Around that time there was a weekly market and an annual fair but they both died out quickly. On the 1871 census there were six married couples and twenty-seven single people in{Scawsby.}Not much of a change in five hundred years!
